skill.name: devops-iac-engineer
skill.description: Implements infrastructure as code using Terraform, Kubernetes, and cloud platforms. Designs scalable architectures, CI/CD pipelines, and observability solutions. Provides security-first DevOps practices and site reliability engineering guidance.
skill.summary: Implements infrastructure as code using Terraform, Kubernetes, and cloud platforms. Designs scalable...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: The skill contains utility scripts that perform local DevOps tasks including Terraform initialization, Kubernetes manifest validation, and secret scanning. All code execution is local with no network calls. Risk factors include script execution and filesystem access, but these are standard for DevOps tools.

content.value_statement: Building and managing cloud infrastructure manually is error-prone and hard to reproduce. This skill provides proven patterns for Terraform, Kubernetes, and CI/CD so you can deploy production-ready infrastructure reliably.
actual_capabilities: Design and implement Terraform modules for multi-cloud infrastructure
Create production-ready Kubernetes deployments with security controls
Build CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and ArgoCD
Implement observability with Prometheus, Grafana, and structured logging
Apply DevSecOps practices including secrets management and security scanning
Set up GitOps workflows for automated infrastructure reconciliation
limitations: Does not execute infrastructure changes without user approval
Requires cloud provider credentials to be configured separately
Cannot access existing cloud accounts or resources without credentials
Does not provide direct access to Kubernetes clusters

use_cases.title: Create reusable IaC modules
use_cases.description: Build standardized Terraform modules that your development teams can use to provision infrastructure consistently.

use_cases.title: Deploy production clusters
use_cases.description: Set up secure Kubernetes clusters with proper RBAC, network policies, and observability ready for production workloads.

use_cases.title: Implement monitoring stacks
use_cases.description: Configure Prometheus alerts, Grafana dashboards, and distributed tracing to meet your SLI and SLO targets.

prompt_templates.title: New Terraform Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me initialize a new Terraform project structure for AWS with separate environments for dev, staging, and production. Include VPC, security groups, and ALB modules.

prompt_templates.title: K8s Deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a production-ready Kubernetes deployment manifest for my application. Include security context, resource limits, health probes, and HPA configuration.

prompt_templates.title: CI/CD Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a GitHub Actions workflow that builds a Docker image, runs security scans with Trivy, and deploys to Kubernetes with manual approval for production.

prompt_templates.title: GitOps Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up ArgoCD with an ApplicationSet that manages deployments across dev, staging, and production environments. Include sync policies and health checks.

best_practices: Always use remote state with locking (S3 + DynamoDB for AWS) to prevent concurrent modifications and state corruption
Implement least privilege access using IAM roles and Kubernetes RBAC instead of long-lived credentials
Scan all infrastructure code for secrets and vulnerabilities before committing to version control
anti_patterns: Hardcoding credentials or secrets in Terraform files or Kubernetes manifests
Managing Terraform state manually or committing state files to Git
Running containers as root or without resource limits in production

faq.question: Which cloud providers are supported?
faq.answer: AWS, Azure, and GCP are fully supported with provider-specific examples and best practices.

faq.question: What is the maximum infrastructure complexity supported?
faq.answer: From simple single-server deployments to complex multi-region, multi-tier architectures with autoscaling.

faq.question: Can this integrate with existing Terraform state?
faq.answer: Yes, point to your existing state files by configuring the backend in your Terraform configuration.

faq.question: Is my infrastructure data safe?
faq.answer: All operations are local. No infrastructure data is sent anywhere. Use cloud provider credentials securely.

faq.question: Why is my Terraform plan failing?
faq.answer: Common causes include missing provider configuration, invalid syntax, or credentials not properly configured.

faq.question: How does this compare to Terraform Cloud or Pulumi?
faq.answer: This skill provides code patterns and guidance. Terraform Cloud offers managed state and policy enforcement. Pulumi uses general-purpose languages.
